result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas P. Mijal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Douglas P. Mijal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Douglas P. Mijal was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for precriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counselings as deemed appropriate by the dept.
NO days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas P. Mijal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:46 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty William Drengler.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Battery)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 2:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:40 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty William Drengler. 
Atty Drengler makes statement and states belief matter will be resolved. 
COURT removes jury trial date. 
COURT sets calendar call for 5/13/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 1:41 pm

Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. No contact with victim(s): A.D. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
